chargeHist.descr: Deliver Heroin within 1000 feet of park as repeater (<3g)

result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Stephanie R. NOVAK is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
On count 1, the State moves to delete both enhancers.  Motion granted.
To the amended charge of Deliver heroin, the defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Convicted.
State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2 and 3.  Motion granted.
The Court orders a Presentence Investigation Report.
PSI is due by 09-14-15.
Sentencing is set for 09-22-15 at 1:30 p.m.
The Court orders the defendant to submit to a DNA sample.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.
The parties have reached an agreement.  Attorney Pangburn requests a new plea date.
Plea date is reset to 07-21-15 at 1:30 p.m.
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 07-14-15 @ 3:30 p.m. BR-3.

Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
Cover Letter.

Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 04-24-15 at 11:00 a.m.  Plea date is set for 07-14-15 at 3:30 p.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery. 
Minutes.
Warrant cancelled and returned to Clerk of Court.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 03-19-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours.  Bail furnished.   Court orders the arrest warrant cancelled. 
Minutes.
RE:  Deliver heroin within 1000 feet of park as repeater, on 01-20-15.
